text:
Blue Giant (Movie)
--------------------

### Introduction

Blue Giant is a Japanese animated film directed by Yuzuru Tachikawa and produced by CoMix Wave Films. The story revolves around three high school students who form a jazz band named "JASS." The protagonist, Katsuragi Koji (played by Yūki Yamada), is a saxophonist deeply in love with jazz music. He moves to Tokyo to pursue his dream of becoming a professional musician and ends up living in the same apartment building as his childhood friend, Sugimoto Jun'ichirō (voiced by Okamoto Amane), who plays the piano. One day, they meet another student, Sakaguchi Snow ( voiced by Mamiya Shotaro), an accordion player, and invite him to join their band. Together, they aim to change the face of jazz music in Japan by performing at the best jazz venue in town.
